projects.title: Projects
projects.mobiText: Mobi is an interactive mobile application developed to collect data on urban transportation and the movement of students and staff at CEFET-RJ. The tool also aims to promote improvements in the mobility experience of the academic community, based on real data.
projects.mobiDashboardText: Mobi Dashboards is an interactive web application developed for visualizing and extracting insights from urban transport and commuting data for students and staff at CEFET-RJ. The tool also aims to foster improvements in the mobility experience of the academic community, based on real data collected via the MOBI app.
projects.fastInvestText: Fast Invest is an interactive web application aimed at investors who want to organize, analyze, and track their investments in a practical and personalized way. The platform was designed to offer advanced tools for filtering, monitoring, and analyzing stocks, helping users make informed and strategic decisions in the financial market.
projects.locadoraCefetText: This work was developed during Web Development classes at CEFET-RJ UNED Nova Iguaçu. During development, we had our first contactHTTP methods and CRUD operations.

mobi.description1: Mobi is an interactive mobile application developed to collect data related to urban transportation and the commutes of students and employees of CEFET-RJ. The tool seeks to promote improvements in the mobility experience of the academic community based on the analysis of real data.
mobi.description2: The platform aims to support the understanding of the mobility patterns of the academic community, contributing to the identification of bottlenecks, route optimization, and improvement of the daily commuting experience.
mobi.description3: The central focus of the project is on collecting and analyzing real mobility data, enabling the generation of relevant information for urban and institutional planning.
mobi.description4: In addition, the system offers route visualization on maps, real-time location, user authentication, and integration with external services, providing an interactive, secure, and informative experience for users.
mobi.featureText1: Allows the recording of actual travel data, using information collected directly during the routes traveled by users.
mobi.featureText2: Enables the visualization of collected routes and itineraries on an interactive map, facilitating the analysis of the routes taken.
mobi.featureText3: Uses the mobile device's GPS to identify and automatically fill in information about the sections traveled during the itineraries.
mobi.featureText4: Authentication system aimed at students and public servants, including technical high school students, undergraduate students, and employees of the institution.
mobi.featureText5: Real-time location service that allows users to view the current distance to the end point of the registered itinerary.
mobi.learningText1: Development of integration with external APIs, in addition to the main API of the system backend. The ViaCEP API was used to search for addresses by ZIP code, the Nominatim API (OpenStreetMap) for geolocation, and the Google Directions API for plotting the routes collected on maps.
mobi.learningText2: Implementation of authentication based on JWT tokens, stored securely using Android Keychain, ensuring greater protection of user information.
mobi.learningText3: Development planning through the creation of Use Case, Class, Sequence, and Entity-Relationship diagrams, aiming to standardize, organize, and document the system structure.
mobi.learningText4: Implementation of unit and integration tests to ensure system quality, security, and reliability, with test automation using GitHub Actions, ensuring correct operation before deployments.

mobiDashboards.description1: Mobi Dashboards is an interactive web application developed to visualize and extract insights from urban transportation data and the commutes of CEFET-RJ students and staff.
mobiDashboards.description2: The platform aims to support the understanding of mobility patterns in the academic community, contributing to the identification of bottlenecks, route optimization, and improvement of the commuting experience, based on real data collected through the MOBI application.
mobiDashboards.description3: The central focus of the project is to conduct exploratory data analysis using interactive dashboards that facilitate the interpretation of complex information through graphs, tables, and dynamic filters.
mobiDashboards.description4: In addition, the system offers data export and analysis features in multiple formats (Excel, PDF, CSV, and Word), enabling its reuse in academic research, institutional reports, and other external applications.
mobiDashboards.featureText1: Disponibiliza gráficos e tabelas interativos com dados extraídos, tratados e analisados.
mobiDashboards.featureText2: Permite filtrar as visualizações por campos como curso, cargo, cidade, gênero, data do itinerário e mais.
mobiDashboards.featureText3: Permite a exportação dos gráficos disponibilizados como PNG e das tabelas e informações consultadas em PDF, Excel, Word e CSV.
mobiDashboards.featureText4: Sistema de autenticação para administradores, gestores e colaboradores, permitindo separação por cargos.
mobiDashboards.featureText5: Visualização de logs do sistema em conjunto ao tratamento de exceções, permitindo o gerenciamento de erros ocorridos assim como dos acessos e ações dos usuários no sistema.
mobiDashboards.learningText1: Development of an integrated architecture between Flask and Streamlit, with a clear separation between backend, dashboards, and frontend, ensuring scalability and project organization.
mobiDashboards.learningText2: Treatment, cleaning, and exploratory analysis of real urban mobility data, using Pandas and statistical techniques to generate relevant insights, including the development of a Machine Learning model.
mobiDashboards.learningText3: Implementation of authentication based on HttpOnly JWT tokens, protection against CSRF, and application of good security practices, such as sending HSTS and CSP headers.
mobiDashboards.learningText4: Development of a logging system combined with exception handling, enabling the management of errors, accesses, and actions performed by users in the system.
mobiDashboards.learningText5: Planning development by creating Use Case, Class, Sequence, and Entity-Relationship diagrams to standardize, organize, and document the system structure.
mobiDashboards.learningText6: Implementation of unit and integration tests to ensure quality, security, and reliability, with test automation through GitHub Actions, ensuring correct operation before deployments.

fastInvest.description1: Fast Invest is an interactive web application designed for investors who want to organize, analyze, and track their investments in a practical, intuitive, and personalized way.
fastInvest.description2: The platform was developed with the aim of offering advanced tools for filtering, monitoring, and analyzing financial assets, helping users make more informed and strategic decisions in the capital market.
fastInvest.description3: The central focus of the project is on clear and efficient data visualization, allowing investors to understand the performance of their assets through indicators, historical data, and comparisons between different stocks.
fastInvest.description4: In addition, the system offers features that promote organization, portfolio customization, and continuous learning about the financial market, integrating technology, usability, and data analysis into a single solution.
fastInvest.featureText1: Create and manage multiple investment portfolios according to your profile and objectives, using filters based on values, indicators, and financial asset indices.
fastInvest.featureText2: Organize and select stocks using custom filters, allowing you to search for specific assets and view detailed information about each one.
fastInvest.featureText3: Use interactive charts to compare the performance of different assets over time, making it easier to identify opportunities and market trends.
fastInvest.featureText4: View complete information about each asset, including price history, dividends, financial indicators, and performance metrics.
fastInvest.learningText1: Application of modern architecture concepts, separation of responsibilities, and best practices in the development of scalable web applications.
fastInvest.learningText2: Processing, organization, and consumption of financial data obtained from the Brapi API, enabling accurate analysis of assets available on the market.
fastInvest.learningText3: Implementation of authentication based on HttpOnly JWT tokens, in addition to mechanisms to protect against CSRF attacks, ensuring greater security for users.
fastInvest.learningText4: Use of Specification and Criteria patterns to build flexible and dynamic queries.
fastInvest.learningText5: Application of the Data Transfer Object (DTO) standard for standardization and security in communication between application layers.

locadoraCefet.description1: The CEFET Rental Project was developed as a PHP application with the aim of applying fundamental concepts of web development and databases in a practical and functional scenario.
locadoraCefet.description2: During development, participants were able to deepen their knowledge of programming logic, HTTP requests and responses, database connection, and full implementation of CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) methods.
locadoraCefet.description3: The application has features such as user authentication, password recovery, search for items registered in the database, and administrative panels, allowing the administrator to manage users and system resources efficiently.
locadoraCefet.featureText1: Allows the administrator to register, edit, and remove vehicles from the system, as well as enabling users to rent and return available items.
locadoraCefet.featureText2: Users can view and search for registered vehicles through an organized catalog, facilitating navigation and selection of the desired item.
locadoraCefet.featureText3: The system offers an administrative area dedicated to user control, allowing you to view information, manage permissions, and maintain the organization of the platform.
locadoraCefet.learningText1: Hands-on learning about creating, reading, updating, and deleting data using PHP integrated with a relational database.
locadoraCefet.learningText2: Use of session variables and cookies to control authentication, access permissions, and persistence of user information.
locadoraCefet.learningText3: Implementation of email sending features, including password recovery, using the SMTP protocol for secure communication.
